titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress regarding the United States position on the disinsection of aircraft at the 11th meeting of the Facilitation Division of the International Civil Aviation Organization.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Policy, Trade and Environment.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: House Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations, and Human Rights

bill.summary: 10/5/1994--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the U.S. delegation to the spring 1995 meeting of the facilitation division of the International Civil Aviation Organization should seek: (1) to amend the Convention on International Civil Aviation to end aircraft disinsection practices that threaten the health of aircraft passengers and crew; and (2) the support and cosponsorship of other member nations of the organization for that amendment.
